publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To his most louing Master, I. R. the Contriuer of this Worke.
analytic.author: Renatus, Misonices

monogr.title: Differences in matters of religion, betweene the easterne and westerne churches : VVherein the Romane Church may see her selfe charged with as many errours, as shee falsly layeth to the charge of other churches in Europe. Gathered by Irenæus Rodoginus
monogr.author: Rodoginus, Irenaeus

div.head: To his most louing Master, I. R. the Contriuer of this Worke.
div.l: HEre Schismes, and rents, and breaches manifold,
(With weeping eyes, which now I doe behold)
Thou hast layd out before the view of men,
With thine exact, and Peace-desiring Pen.
Well dost thou wish, for which I wish thee well:
Yet wishing doth not fiery darts repell.
But, Oh that Kings and Potentates their best
Would doe, and so yeeld to thy sweet request:
Then should Peace shine, and Gordian knots now fast
Dissolued bee, and into Lethe cast.
